intro: Corydalis foetida, commonly known as the stinking corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its attractive flowers and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
